content.p: The Identities, Citizenship, Equalities and Migration Centre is a large and diverse centre, whose members conduct research across a wide range of areas within the centre's research clusters of (1) migration and displacement, (2) race and ethnicity, (3) class, inequalities, and citizenship, and (4) religion and spirituality. You may view personal profiles for our members, with further information about current research projects and interests, by clicking on the links below. Alternatively, visit the Research page to read some examples of current work within the centre. ICEMiC Director: Dr Morteza Hashemi School of Sociology and Social Policy Law and Social Sciences building University of Nottingham University Park Nottingham, NG7 2RD +44 (0)115 951 5393
